subject: Marketing
title: Social Comparison Shopping
description: A short lesson to help you apply Social Comparison Shopping.

hook.text: Your neighbor parks a new Tesla in the driveway. Suddenly your car feels inadequate.

buildup.text: Social comparison theory says we evaluate ourselves by looking at others.

discovery.text: Conspicuous consumption exists because products signal status in the social hierarchy.

twist.text: Instagram intensified this. People buy experiences to photograph, not to enjoy.

climax.text: Luxury brands thrive on visible logos because the audience isn't the buyerâ€”it's everyone watching.

punchline.text: We don't buy for ourselves. We buy for the audience.

quiz.question: Why do luxury brands use visible logos?
options: The real audience is everyone watching, not just the buyer
Logos are cheaper than other forms of branding
Visible logos are legally required for luxury goods
